title: Management System
description: Establishes the foundation of the food safety management system including documented policies, organizational structure, food safety culture, training systems, allergen control, and management review processes

requirements.text: Is there a documented food safety policy detailing the company's commitment to food safety?
mandatoryStatements: Food safety policy is documented in writing
Policy details the company's commitment to food safety
Policy is signed by top management
Policy is communicated to all relevant personnel
Policy is reviewed and updated at defined intervals
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of food safety policy during management review
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Policy communication verified during employee orientation and annual training

requirements.text: Is there an established, implemented, and maintained food safety culture assessment plan that includes at least the following elements: communication, training, employee feedback, and performance measurement on food safety-related activities?
mandatoryStatements: Food safety culture assessment plan is documented
Plan includes communication strategies for food safety
Training component addresses food safety culture
Employee feedback mechanisms are established
Performance measurement methods for food safety activities are defined
Assessment is conducted at regular intervals
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of food safety culture assessment activities and results
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of culture indicators, employee feedback collection, and performance metrics

requirements.text: Is there an organizational chart showing all management and workers who are involved in safety related activities and documentation (job descriptions) detailing their food safety responsibilities?
mandatoryStatements: Current organizational chart shows all personnel involved in food safety activities
Chart clearly identifies reporting relationships
Job descriptions exist for all food safety-related positions
Job descriptions detail specific food safety responsibilities
Authority levels for food safety decisions are clearly defined
Organizational structure supports food safety management system
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of organizational chart and job descriptions for accuracy and completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Update organizational chart within 30 days of personnel changes affecting food safety roles

requirements.text: Is there a food safety committee and are there logs of food safety meetings with topics covered and attendees?
mandatoryStatements: Food safety committee is established with defined membership
Committee includes representatives from key operational areas
Meeting logs document date, attendees, and topics discussed
Action items and responsible parties are recorded
Meetings occur at regular intervals (minimum quarterly)
Records demonstrate follow-up on action items
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of food safety committee meeting records for completeness and follow-through
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that meetings occurred and action items were addressed

requirements.text: Is there a training management system in place that shows what types of training are required for various job roles of specific workers, including who has been trained, when they were trained, which trainings they still need to take, and a training schedule?
mandatoryStatements: Training management system identifies required training by job role
System tracks individual employee training completion
Training dates and trainer information are recorded
System identifies training gaps and upcoming training needs
Training schedule is maintained and followed
Training effectiveness is evaluated
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that training is current for all employees and gaps are being addressed
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly review of training completion status and schedule adherence

requirements.text: Is there a documented allergen control program?
mandatoryStatements: Allergen control program is documented in writing
Program identifies all allergens present in facility
Procedures address allergen handling and storage
Cross-contact prevention measures are defined
Cleaning and sanitation procedures for allergen control are established
Labeling requirements for allergen-containing products are specified
Employee training on allergen control is required
Verification activities confirm program effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual allergen program review, quarterly verification of allergen controls, annual allergen cleaning validation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring of allergen controls, immediate verification after allergen changeovers

requirements.text: Is there documented management verification review of the entire food safety management system at least every 12 months, including an evaluation of resources, and are there records of changes made?
mandatoryStatements: Management review is conducted at least annually
Review covers entire food safety management system
Resource adequacy is evaluated (personnel, equipment, infrastructure)
Review includes analysis of food safety performance data
Internal and external audit results are reviewed
Customer feedback and complaints are considered
Changes and improvements are identified and documented
Action items are assigned with responsible parties and timelines
Follow-up on previous review action items is included
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that management review occurred and covered all required elements
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of management review action item completion

requirements.text: Where specific industry guidelines or best practices exist for the crop and/or product, does the operation have a current copy of the document?
mandatoryStatements: Relevant industry guidelines and best practices are identified
Current copies of applicable documents are maintained
Documents are accessible to relevant personnel
Guidelines are incorporated into facility procedures where applicable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review to ensure industry guidelines are current and applicable
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly check for updates to industry guidelines and best practices

capaInject: If food safety policy is outdated or not communicated: update policy immediately, re-communicate to all staff within 7 days
If food safety culture gaps identified: develop action plan within 30 days, implement improvements within 90 days
If organizational chart or job descriptions are outdated: update within 14 days, communicate changes to affected personnel
If training gaps identified: provide required training within 30 days or remove from food safety-related duties
If allergen control failures detected: immediate product hold, investigation within 24 hours, corrective actions before restart
If management review not conducted: complete review within 30 days, address any identified resource or system gaps
traceabilityInject: Training records must be traceable to specific employees, training dates, and trainers
Food safety committee meeting records must be traceable to specific dates and action items
Management review records must trace decisions and changes to specific review meetings
Allergen control records must be traceable to specific products, batches, and control measures
